Detailed Description

This class is used to manage the sensor data from the device.

The SnesorManager class is used to manage the sensor data from the device.

There are methods for adding or removing sensor listener, checking sensor availability, setting interval, getting sensor's detail information.

The following example demonstrates how to use the SensorManager 

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
  //new SensorManager instance
  SensorManager *mSM = new SensorManager(Context);

  //check whether a sensor is available or not
  mSM->IsAvailable(SensorManager::SENSORS_TYPE_ACCELERATION);

  //check a sensor information
  mSM->GetMaximumRange(SensorManager::SENSORS_TYPE_ACCELERATION);
  mSM->GetResolution(SensorManager::SENSORS_TYPE_ACCELERATION);
 }
See also:
SensorEventListener
SensorData

enum gaia::system::SensorManager::SensorDelay

The following flag are defined to ensure the sensor data rate.

Enumerator:
SENSOR_DELAY_FASTEST 

Get sensor data as fast as possible.

See also:
SENSOR_DELAY_GAME
SENSOR_DELAY_UI
SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL
SENSOR_DELAY_GAME 

Sensor data rate is suitable for games.

See also:
SENSOR_DELAY_FASTEST
SENSOR_DELAY_UI
SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL
SENSOR_DELAY_UI 

Sensor data rate is suitable for the user interface.

See also:
SENSOR_DELAY_FASTEST
SENSOR_DELAY_GAME
SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL
SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL 

The default data rate.

See also:

Member Function Documentation

bool gaia::system::SensorManager::addSensorListener ( const SensorEventListener &  listener,
SensorType  sensorType,
int32_t  interval,
bool  dataChange 
)

Add a sensor listener for the given sensor.

Sensor power on for first time and adds a sensor listener.

Parameters:
[in]listenerThe listener to add.
[in]sensorTypeThe type of sensor.
[in]intervalThe rate of sensor data are delivered (in microsecond). The value must be one of SENSOR_DELAY_FASTEST, SENSOR_DELAY_GAME, SENSOR_DELAY_UI or SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL, or the desired delay between events in microsecond.
[in]dataChangeSet to true if the sensor data is received only when the sensor data is changed.
Returns:
true if the sensor available and successfully enabled.
gaia::system::SensorManager::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( SensorManager  ) [private]
Sensor* gaia::system::SensorManager::getDefaultSensorN ( SensorType  sensorType)
float gaia::system::SensorManager::getMaximumRange ( SensorType  sensorType)

Gets the maximum measurement range of the sensor.

Parameters:
[in]sensorTypeThe type of sensor.
Returns:
The value of maximum measurement range. If sensor doesn't provide measurement range or not available in this device, the return value is -1.
float gaia::system::SensorManager::getResolution ( SensorType  sensorType)

Gets the resolution of the sensor.

Parameters:
[in]sensorTypeThe type of sensor.
Returns:
The value of sensor's resolution. If sensor doesn't provide resolution value or not available in this device, the return value is -1.
gaia::base::Vector<Sensor *> gaia::system::SensorManager::getSensorListN ( SensorType  sensorType)
bool gaia::system::SensorManager::isAvailable ( SensorType  sensorType)

Check whether the type of sensor is available on the device.

Parameters:
[in]sensorTypeThe type of snesor.
Returns:
true if the sensor type is available.
void gaia::system::SensorManager::removeSensorListener ( const SensorEventListener &  listener,
SensorType  sensorType 
)

Removes a sensor listener from a type of sensor.

Sensor powers down when every listener to the type of sensor is removed.

Parameters:
[in]listenerThe listener to add.
[in]sensorTypeThe type of sensor.
void gaia::system::SensorManager::removeSensorListener ( const SensorEventListener &  listener)

Removes a sensor listener from all the types of sensor.

Sensor powers down when every listener added to the type of sensor is removed.

Parameters:
[in]listenerThe listener to add.
